People who sue companies are primarily motivated by financial gain.
column13:

Diversity initiatives (e.g., targeted hiring or promotions) unfairly advantage certain groups such as women and minorities.

Employers should consider race as one of several factors when making hiring and promotion decisions.

When someone says "I don't see color" or declines to participate in diversity programs, it indicates racial bias.
